result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:56 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Scott M Mueller appeared by Zoom.  Attorney David Michael Stegall appeared by Zoom for Scott M Mueller. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Attorney and defendant can appear by zoom
To Adjourn 09/01/22 court appearance.
Letter dated 08/30/22 requesting adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Atty David Stegall

Payable Number: 473535,
Receipt Number: 22R 036499,
Amount: $20.00
Wisconsin Community Service letter dated August 19, 2022 letting Court know that defendant reported to WCS for installation of the SCRAM bracelet.
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services for 90 days or following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant to have CAM monitor installed before going to Las Vegas.

2:32 PM Defendant Scott M Mueller in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erk Schlueter, as a friend of the court.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
